You will be part of our DCE department where no two days are the same. We maintain and improve our current products and develop new solutions by working closely with engineering, supply chain and service, all driven by our customer needs. Our activities are based all over the world and each project is different. These projects improve the business of our external customers within the Airports, Parcel, and Warehousing markets with our scalable products like conveyors, sorters, work cells and/or storage solutions. Every one of our talented R&D engineers are committed to solving the next challenge, and enhancing Vanderlande s competitive position.             Your Responsibilities         As group Leader you manage a team with a multidisciplinary background, for example mechanical, electrical, PLC, system designers, integration etc. You will lead this group as line manager in which you facilitate their growth, agile way of working and product development related activities. In parallel, you will also steer towards and safeguard standardization, process adherence and process optimization. In this role, you will work closely together within a global management team to ensure the right people and competences are available for the right projects to be successful.     As an enthusiastic, result driven and natural team leader, you will:         Be employee focused to nurture them so that they are equipped to be at their best and happiest,         Play a vital role in maintaining our vibrant people culture based on customer centricity, trust, feed forward, continuous learning and fun,         Act as people lead to create, facilitate, coach and motivate the people in their personal and job profession development opportunities,         Manage 20+ employees, including hiring and onboarding new team members, drive performance incl. appraisals and coordinate people operations,         Work together with product owners, scrum masters and agile coaches in order to implement and improve the agile way of working within the department.                 Your qualifications and skills             Within our dynamic project environment, you feel energized by connecting and motivating people to bring out the best in them,         Proven experience in hands on people operations and using excellent communication by leading (international) teams of technical specialists,         You get shiny eyes as soon as you experience and talk about our products,         You are a smart self-starter with a flexible mindset and pro-active spirit,         You have a continuous improvement focus and attitude,         You enjoy working in a R&D environment within a corporate company,         Fluency in written and spoken Dutch and English,         You have a Bachelor or Master Degree and a great affinity with technology and have acquired at least 5 years of relevant working experience,         Certification or experience as PSM / CSM or PSPO / CSPO in a mechatronic development environment is a plus.

column1: Engineer or Lead Engineer-Lab Process Control
column2: Role & responsibilities   Hands on experience on the periodic bath analysis and tests for all the chemical processes such as tartaric acid anodizing, chromic acid anodizing, boric acid anodizing, cadmium plating, zinc plating, passivation, hard anodizing, chemical conversion coating, painting and shot peen. Hands on experience on the periodic qualifications for the above mentioned surface treatment, finishing operations and surface enhancement processes mentioned above. Hands on experience on all the equipment used in testing and analysis in the laboratory Hands on experience on ICP-OES Optimize bath solution controls to achieve process capability and productivity Efficient and effective bath make up / replacement and top up frequency linked to productivity Critical thinking, trouble shooting and problem solving of surface treatment processes and decision making Teamwork and collaboration Professionalism and strong work ethic Oral and written communications skills Good specific technical skills, knowledge, and expertise to perform functions related to laboratory Human or interpersonal management skills Experience in quality management systems, customer and statutory and regulatory requirements  AS9100, ISO 17025, NADCAP, REACH, ROHS, Conflict Minerals, KSPCB, etc Plan, procure and maintain laboratory inventories as per defined target levels Review and approval of test reports, internal periodic qualifications in accordance with ISO/IEC 17025 Collaborate with the multifunctional team for establishing new process qualifications. Ability to train and certify Chemists on various tests conducted at the laboratory Ability to conduct and validate profiency testing, homogeneity tests, round robin tests, intermediate checks and internal quality checks,etc. Capability to develop necessary procedures, work instructions in accordance with ISO 17025, Standards and customer specifications Addition of scopes in ISO/IEC 17025 accreditation to set up independent lab.  Preferred candidate profile   Aerospace industry - special process   Lead the laboratory of the organization Responsible for the performance of the laboratory Responsible for sustenance and maintenance of the quality management systems AS9100, ISO 17025 NADCAP accreditation related to laboratory Responsible for process control of special processes such as such as tartaric acid anodizing, boric sulphuric acid anodizing, cadmium plating, zinc plating, passivation, chromic acid anodizing, painting, etc. Upkeep of the laboratory, 5S, record management, etc. Achieve business targets and continual improvement Responsible for the training and competence of the chemists Plan, organize and monitor to ensure smooth functioning of the laboratory    Educational   Background:  Chemical Engineering / M.Sc. Chemistry   Hands on experience of around 5-10 years of experience in laboratory (process control)  Relevant work experience is highly desirable.

Key Responsibilities: Flight Booking: Handle flight reservations for customers, including providing options for different routes, airlines, and schedules. Ticketing: Issue tickets accurately and efficiently, ensuring adherence to airline policies and regulations. Customer Service: Provide excellent customer service by addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and assisting with special requests. Fare Calculation: Calculate fares based on routing, class of service, and applicable fees, while ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies. Itinerary Management: Prepare and distribute travel itineraries to customers, including details such as flight times, layovers, and contact information. Documentation: Ensure all necessary travel documents, such as visas and passports, are valid and in order before issuing tickets. Collaboration: Coordinate with other departments, such as sales and operations, to ensure seamless customer service and resolve any issues that may arise. Reporting: Maintain accurate records of bookings, transactions, and customer interactions for reporting and analysis purposes. Stay Informed: Keep abreast of industry trends, airline policies, and changes in regulations to provide up-to-date information to customers. Upselling: Identify opportunities to upsell additional services such as travel insurance, seat upgrades, or hotel accommodations to enhance the customer's travel experience.   Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's degree in hospitality management, tourism, or a related field preferred. Experience: Prior experience in airline ticketing, travel agency, or related industry preferred. Computer Skills: Proficiency in using airline reservation systems (e.g., Amadeus, Sabre, Galileo) and Microsoft Office suite. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and any additional languages are advantageous. Attention to Detail: Strong attention to detail to ensure accuracy in ticketing and documentation. Customer Focus: Ability to prioritize customer needs and deliver high-quality service in a fast-paced environment. Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to quickly identify and resolve issues to ensure customer satisfaction. Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing schedules, priorities, and customer demands. Team Player: Ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and other departments to achieve common goals. Professionalism: Maintain a professional demeanor and uphold ethical standards in all interactions with customers and colleagues. Perks And Benefits:   Travel Discounts: Access to discounted or complimentary airfare for personal travel, including standby tickets or discounted rates on flights, hotels, and rental cars. Performance Bonuses: Performance-based bonuses or incentives based on individual or team achievements, such as meeting sales targets or maintaining high customer satisfaction scores. Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance coverage, including medical, dental, and vision plans, to ensure employees' well-being and peace of mind. Retirement Plans: Enrollment in a company-sponsored retirement savings plan, such as a 401(k) or pension scheme, with employer contributions or matching to help employees save for the future. Flexible Work Schedule: Opportunities for flexible working hours, remote work options, or compressed workweeks to promote work-life balance and accommodate personal commitments. Training and Development: Access to ongoing training programs, workshops, or certifications to enhance professional skills and career advancement opportunities within the company. Paid Time Off: Generous vacation days, sick leave, and paid holidays to allow employees to rest, recharge, and spend time with family and friends. Travel Perks: Additional travel-related perks, such as complimentary airport lounge access, priority boarding, or upgrades on personal and business travel. Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Access to counseling services, financial planning assistance, or wellness programs to support employees' physical, mental, and emotional well-being. Employee Recognition: Recognition programs, awards, or employee of the month initiatives to celebrate outstanding performance and contributions to the team. Company Events and Activities: Participation in company-sponsored events, team-building activities, or social gatherings to foster a sense of camaraderie and community among employees. Transit Benefits: Subsidized or discounted transit passes, parking allowances, or commuter benefits to assist with transportation costs for commuting to and from work. These perks and benefits can help attract top talent, boost employee morale and job satisfaction, and contribute to a positive work environment within the air travel industry.

column2: AVIONICS ENGINEER PRYM Aerospace Pvt Ltd Introduction Prym Aerospace Pvt Ltd: State-of-the-art drone manufacturer with a wide range of uses, including aerial photography, industrial inspections, and agricultural. Dedicated to improving unmanned aviation while maintaining quality, safety, and regulatory compliance. The role We are seeking a talented and motivated Avionics Engineer to join our Research & Development (R&D) Department in the drone/aerospace industry. The successful candidate will be responsible for the design, development, and testing of avionics systems for unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and related projects. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and contribute to the advancement of aerospace engineering. Key   Responsibilities ??Design and develop avionics systems for UAVs, including flight control, navigation,  communication, and sensor integration with development boards such as STM32. ??Conduct testing and validation of avionics systems to ensure performance, reliability,  and regulatory compliance. ??Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate avionics systems into UAV platforms, ensuring compatibility and functionality. ??Analyse system requirements and specifications to define avionics architecture and  functionality, considering power budgeting (voltage and current). ??Manage procurement of avionics components and equipment, adhering to quality  standards and project timelines. ??Support UAV flight testing and operations, troubleshooting avionics issues, and implementing solutions as needed. ??Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry trends in avionics engineering and UAV systems. ??Provide technical expertise and guidance on avionics systems to support business development activities and customer engagements. ??Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements governing avionics design, testing, and operations. Key skills and experience required. ??B. Tech/M. Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering/Electronics and Electrical Engineering or related field. ??Minimum of 0-2 years of experience in avionics engineering or related field. ??Proficiency in avionics design software (Altium Designer, Eagle), simulation tools  (MATLAB/Simulink), and programming languages (C, C++,Java ,Python). ??Hands-on experience with avionics testing and validation procedures. ??Strong understanding of avionics systems, including flight control, navigation,  communication, and sensor technologies. ??Experience with sensor integration with development boards such as STM32. ??Knowledgeable in power budgeting, including voltage (V) and current (I)  considerations. ??Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills. ??Effective communication and collaboration skills, both verbal and written. ??Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team.
column11: Matlab Simulink, C Coding, Java, Javascript, Python
